title: Shawl, mid-19th century
medium:
Medium: wool, silk
Technique: black center and fringe: 2/2 twill panels and borders: complementary weft, patterned 3/1 twill
(all panels and borders, including fringe, are woven, cut and attached)
dimensions: L x W: 287 x 134 cm (9 ft. 5 in. x 52 3/4 in.)
description: Rectangular shawl with wide borders at each end and narrow borders on each side; made up of woven and cut pieces of fabric with a set-in black center or field.  The primary border at each end contains five elaborately foliated cones.  The ivory is silk throughout.

tombstone.epitaph:
Shawl, mid-19th century.
mid-19th century. Medium: wool, silk
Technique: black center and fringe: 2/2 twill panels and borders: complementary weft, patterned 3/1 twill
(all panels and borders, including fringe, are woven, cut and attached). Gift of Augusta F. Berdansky. 1967-83-1.
